title: Self-Regulated Foreign Language Learning Emotional Management Strategies in Online Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of foreign language teaching methodologies and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Pre-service science teachers acquiring self-regulated learning strategies to manage emotional factors (anxiety/pleasure) experienced in foreign language learning within online interactive environments

learning_goals: Learners can reduce foreign language learning anxiety by 20% by applying self-regulated learning strategies in real-time online classes
Learners can apply at least three techniques to enhance Foreign Language Enjoyment (FLE) through interactions with peer teachers and instructors
Learners can complete self-regulated journaling and feedback requests using smartphone-based tools (note apps, video conferencing) with over 80% adherence

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
